alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Harrison; Mills; Monona; Montgomery; Page; Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 18 at 4:54PM CST until January 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Mills County in southwestern Iowa... Southwestern Shelby County in southwestern Iowa... Southwestern Monona County in west central Iowa... Pottawattamie County in southwestern Iowa... Western Montgomery County in southwestern Iowa... Fremont County in southwestern Iowa... Harrison County in southwestern Iowa... Northwestern Page County in southwestern Iowa... Southeastern Burt County in east central Nebraska... Lancaster County in southeastern Nebraska... Johnson County in southeastern Nebraska... Southeastern Saunders County in east central Nebraska... Washington County in east central Nebraska... Southeastern Dodge County in east central Nebraska... Otoe County in southeastern Nebraska... Nemaha County in southeastern Nebraska... Southeastern Seward County in southeastern Nebraska... Jefferson County in southeastern Nebraska... Douglas County in east central Nebraska... Saline County in southeastern Nebraska... Pawnee County in southeastern Nebraska... Sarpy County in east central Nebraska... Northwestern Richardson County in southeastern Nebraska... Gage County in southeastern Nebraska... Cass County in southeastern Nebraska... * Until 600 PM CST. * At 452 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Onawa to near Omaha to near Beatrice, moving southeast at 40 mph. A second, very narrow but intense snow squall exxtended from near Oakland to near Fremont to near Seward to near McCool Junction, also moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and 50 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 1 and 101. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 43. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 382 and 454. Locations impacted include... Omaha, Lincoln, Council Bluffs, Bellevue, Fremont, Papillion, Beatrice, Blair, Nebraska City, Ralston, Wahoo, Gretna, Fairbury, Auburn, Tekamah, Tecumseh, Bennington, Pawnee City, Boys Town, and Elkhorn. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT

area.areaDesc: Fremont; Harrison; Mills; Monona; Montgomery; Page; Pottawattamie; Shelby
